object.name: replaceStickerInSet
object.description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling deleteStickerFromSet, then addStickerToSet, then setStickerPositionInSet. Returns True on success.
object.html_description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling deleteStickerFromSet, then addStickerToSet, then setStickerPositionInSet. Returns True on success.
object.rst_description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling :class:`aiogram.methods.delete_sticker_from_set.DeleteStickerFromSet`, then :class:`aiogram.methods.add_sticker_to_set.AddStickerToSet`, then :class:`aiogram.methods.set_sticker_position_in_set.SetStickerPositionInSet`. Returns :code:`True` on success.

annotations.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner
annotations.html_description: User identifier of the sticker set owner
annotations.rst_description: User identifier of the sticker set owner
annotations.name: user_id

annotations.description: File identifier of the replaced sticker
annotations.rst_description: File identifier of the replaced sticker
annotations.name: old_sticker

annotations.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.
annotations.html_description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.
annotations.rst_description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.
annotations.name: sticker
